headline.main: In Late Abortions, Decisions Are Painful and Options Few

docs.lead_paragraph: Catherine Stern found out from a sonogram when she was seven months pregnant that she was carrying a fetus with stumps for arms and legs and possible brain damage. "I was in shock," she said. "I was catatonic." Ms. Stern, a lawyer who lives in Turnbridge, Vt., said she and her husband agonized over whether to have an abortion. "I felt as if I was being given a choice," she said, "and if I can find any way I was going to make it a choice." She decided to terminate the pregnancy.
